com.google.appinventor.client.widgets.dnd
Class DragSourceSupport

java.lang.Object
  com.google.appinventor.client.widgets.dnd.DragSourceSupport
All Implemented Interfaces:
MouseListener, EventListener
public final class DragSourceSupport
extends Object
implements MouseListener

Provides support for dragging from a DragSource (typically a widget) to a DropTarget.

Constructor Summary
DragSourceSupport(DragSource dragSource)
          Creates a new instance of this class to provide support for dragging from the specified drag source to any of the drop targets that it defines.
 
Method Summary
static void configureDragWidgetToAppearWithCursorAt(Widget w, int x, int y)
          Configures the specified drag-widget (that will be returned by DragSource.createDragWidget(int, int)) so that the cursor's hot spot will appear at the point (x,y) in the widget's coordinate system.
 Widget getDragWidget()
          Returns the drag widget created by the last call to DragSource.createDragWidget(int, int).
 void onMouseDown(Widget sender, int x, int y)

Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object
clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait
 

Constructor Detail

DragSourceSupport

public DragSourceSupport(DragSource dragSource)
Creates a new instance of this class to provide support for dragging from the specified drag source to any of the drop targets that it defines.

After creation, the caller must add this DragSourceSupport as a MouseListener to whatever actual UIObject will receive drag gestures.

Method Detail

configureDragWidgetToAppearWithCursorAt

public static void configureDragWidgetToAppearWithCursorAt(Widget w,
                                                           int x,
                                                           int y)
Configures the specified drag-widget (that will be returned by DragSource.createDragWidget(int, int)) so that the cursor's hot spot will appear at the point (x,y) in the widget's coordinate system.

getDragWidget

public Widget getDragWidget()
